newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Bank of Korea sells dollars to boost won- dealers.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Korea sells dollars to boost won- dealers.

text.p: The central Bank of Korea (BOK) intervened again in the interbank market in late Wednesday morning trading to halt the won from falling further against the dollar, dealers said.
Dealers said the central bank stepped into the market at around the 821.50 won level.
BOK has never confirmed that it intervenes in the market.
"The central bank seems to determined to keep the dollar/won rate around 820," said a local bank dealer.
Dollar short-covering by some banks pressed the won to a morning low of 823.50 on Wednesday morning. After the suspected intervention, the won was trading at 820.60.
